13:00.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap (Rider Restricted Race)

runners.comment: Runner-up at Wolverhampton eight days ago; shortlisted off same mark
runners.name: Dapper Gee Gee
runners.spotlight: 1-14, the win coming off 1lb lower at Chepstow (7f, good to soft) last summer; runner-up in four of his last six starts including at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) eight days ago; shortlisted off same mark.

runners.comment: Not beaten far over C&D a week ago; each-way claims back down to Class 6 company
runners.name: Enpassant
runners.spotlight: Three wins last year, the latest off 3lb lower at Newcastle (7f, Tapeta) in September; not beaten far when fifth of nine over C&D a week ago and holds each-way claims back down to Class 6 company.

runners.comment: Just 2lb higher than when making all at Wolverhampton eight days ago; considered
runners.name: Nacho Nacho Nacho
runners.spotlight: Upped in trip when making all and just holding on to make it eighth-time lucky at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta; first-time visor) eight days ago; only 2lb higher and doesn't have many miles on the clock; considered.

runners.comment: A well-beaten eighth in all three starts since joining this yard; best watched for now
runners.name: Bavaria Iron
runners.spotlight: 8-26 on turf/AW on the continent (1m-1m2f), but a well-beaten eighth in all three starts since joining this yard; best watched for now unless the market suggests otherwise.

runners.comment: Twice made all at Newmarket last summer; could be dangerous if allowed an uncontested lead
runners.name: Dashing Donkey
runners.spotlight: Made all for both wins at Newmarket (1m, good to soft) last summer; fair fourth of eight at Lingfield (7f, Polytrack) last month when he may have gone for home too soon; could be dangerous if allowed an uncontested lead.

runners.comment: 0-11 but placed in five of his seven starts on Tapeta; each-way claims
runners.name: Jamaican Storm
runners.spotlight: 0-11 but placed in five of his seven starts on Tapeta including one over C&D; third of ten at Newcastle (7f) last month and each-way claims again off the same mark.

runners.comment: Has run well in just two goes over 7f, but needs to put two lesser efforts behind him
runners.name: Winter Crown
runners.owner: Mrs C M Clarke Foulrice Park Racing Ltd
runners.spotlight: Made a successful stable debut at Newcastle (6f, Tapeta) in November; has run well in just two goes over this far, but he needs to put a couple of lesser efforts behind him; stable also runs Pit Boss.

runners.comment: Runner-up five times, including four on the AW, but now 0-14 and looking exposed
runners.name: Invincible Melody
runners.spotlight: In the frame on eight occasions, including when fourth of seven at Chelmsford (6f, Polytrack) on Friday; runner-up five times, including four on the AW, but is now 0-14 and looking exposed; others stronger.

runners.comment: Losing run up to 24 despite a plummeting mark; needs the visor to help halt the slide
runners.name: Swiss Ace
runners.spotlight: Three-time Newcastle winner who has finished runner-up in two of his three starts over C&D, but losing run up to 24 despite a plummeting mark; needs the visor to help halt the slide.

runners.comment: 4lb lower than for his sole success; tongue-tie on; worth a second look
runners.name: Simply Blue
runners.spotlight: 1-22, his sole success coming on his final start for David Loughnane at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) in October; has run with credit a couple of times for this yard and now 4lb lower than for the win; tongue-tie given a go; worth a second look.

runners.comment: Record over C&D reads 2122; off the same mark as when second last time; high on the list
runners.name: Portoro
runners.spotlight: Back near his best when second of 11 here on his latest outing, taking his record over C&D to 2122; races off the same mark and high on the list.

runners.comment: 0-17; more will be needed on his first visit here; blinkers on
runners.name: Pit Boss
runners.spotlight: Placed four times on the Newcastle Tapeta late last year; should appreciate the run to this trip, but is now 0-17 so more will be needed on his first visit here; blinkers the headgear of choice this time.

13:30.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap (Rider Restricted Race)

runners.comment: Won with some authority at Newcastle six days ago; considered under his penalty
runners.name: Gressington
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd Cassie And Wilson
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who took advantage of a drop in the weights when ending a 14-race losing run at Newcastle (7f, Tapeta) six days ago; took that race with some authority, so considered under his penalty.

runners.comment: Twice held since winning at Kempton and wouldn't be sure to get his own way
runners.name: How Impressive
runners.spotlight: Front-runner and C&D winner; back to winning ways when making all at Kempton (7f, Polytrack) in October, but twice held since and wouldn't be sure to get his own way here.

runners.comment: Unplaced in all 12 starts since his latest success; others are more compelling
runners.name: Tough Enough
runners.spotlight: Continues to slide down the weights but unplaced in all 12 starts since his latest success; others are more compelling.

runners.comment: All six wins have come over 1m-1m4f here; has the pace to hold a position over this trip
runners.name: Down To The Kid
runners.spotlight: All six wins have come over 1m-1m4f here, including a hat-trick last spring; returning from seven months off when beaten half a length over 1m here 17 days ago; drops to this trip for the first time since his racecourse debut, but has the pace to hold a prominent position; respected.

runners.comment: Won at Chelmsford in October but inconsistent and still has stamina to prove
runners.name: Sensorium
runners.owner: T Elphick M Broughton & K Shenton
runners.spotlight: Tongue tied for the first time when making a successful return to the AW at Chelmsford (6f, Polytrack) in October, but inconsistent and still has stamina to prove.

runners.comment: Held in two handicaps for this yard since winning a Lingfield maiden; has a bit to prove
runners.name: Panelli
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the eighth attempt in a Lingfield maiden (1m, Polytrack) in September when trained by George Boughey, but held for this yard in two Chelmsford handicaps (6f, Polytrack) with a tongue-tie added; step back up in trip should suit, but he has a bit to prove.

runners.comment: Makes his Tapeta debut on his 42nd outing, so has to prove himself on that front
runners.name: Tadreeb
runners.spotlight: Very much a Lingfield specialist with all five AW wins coming over 7f there; has won twice on turf but makes his Tapeta debut on his 42nd outing, so has to prove himself on that front.

runners.comment: Running well at Newcastle lately but out of the frame in all three goes over this C&D
runners.name: Judgment Call
runners.owner: Paul Corrigan & Miss L A Perratt
runners.spotlight: Newcastle regular who ended a 27-race losing run last month at that course (6f, Tapeta) and again ran well when fourth of ten over the same trip six days ago; stays this far, but has finished out of the frame in all three goes over this C&D.

runners.comment: Only just beaten over this trip at Wolverhampton and Lingfield recently; could go well
runners.name: Havana Sky
runners.spotlight: Completed a five-timer over 6f on the AW at the end of 2024, including two wins here; stays this far and was only just beaten over this trip at Wolverhampton and Lingfield recently; could go well.

runners.comment: Fair fourth at Wolverhampton last time but may need further now
runners.name: Packetofbiscuits
runners.owner: A Pot To Pete In Syndicate
runners.spotlight: Doubled his winning tally when making all in a Leicester seller (7f, good) in October on his final start for Adrian Nicholls; fair fourth of 12 at Wolverhampton (8.6f, Tapeta) eight days ago but he may be suited by further than this nowadays.

runners.comment: Twice well beaten since two wins in the summer; likely to face competition for the lead
runners.name: Finn Ironside
runners.spotlight: Handy sort who was ridden positively when winning at Doncaster (7f, good to soft; first-time tongue-tie) and Newcastle (7f, Tapeta) last summer, but well beaten in both starts since; likely to face competition for the lead.

runners.comment: Unplaced in eight starts but ran better than it looked on stable debut over C&D a week ago
runners.name: Ashen
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in all eight starts and only seventh of nine on stable debut over C&D a week ago, but he did meet trouble and was returning from six months off; no surprise if he fares better.

14:00.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap (Rider Restricted Race) (Div I)

runners.comment: Low-mileage 4yo who went close at Wolverhampton last month and is well drawn again
runners.name: Mythical Isle
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who left a disappointing run behind when close second at Wolverhampton (6f) last month and has the inside draw again here; one to consider.

runners.comment: Back in form with close second at Kempton last month; this return to Tapeta will suit
runners.name: Hint Of The Jungle
runners.spotlight: Still 2lb higher than for narrow C&D win in September but rebounded from two lesser efforts with close second at Kempton (6f) last month and is sure to be suited by this return to Tapeta.

runners.comment: Ended 2025 with two respectable fourths at Newcastle (5f/6f); now back on winning mark
runners.name: What What What
runners.spotlight: Did not progress after making all in first-time visor at Newcastle (5f) last March but ended 2025 with two very respectable fourths there (5f/6f) and is now back on his winning mark.

runners.comment: Well beaten over 8.6f on recent handicap debut; due to drop to 7f here last night
runners.name: Summer Evening
runners.spotlight: Unexposed after only four runs but well beaten at triple-digit odds on recent handicap debut at Wolverhampton (8.6f; wore blinkers); due to drop back to 7f here last night (6.00); this will be her first sprint.

runners.comment: Opened account when dropped back to 6f last month; still unexposed as a sprinter
runners.name: Magna
runners.spotlight: Evidently well suited by drop to 6f when opening account at Kempton last month, her 15th start; drawn much wider here but will be fine back on Tapeta and remains unexposed as a sprinter.

runners.comment: Drop to 5f didn't pay dividends last time; player if judged on earlier 6f third
runners.name: Forever Noah
runners.spotlight: Last of seven when dropped to 5f at Wolverhampton a fortnight ago and he is now 0-13, but his close third over 6f there (just behind Mythical Isle) two runs ago brings him into the equation.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten over 5f on stable debut but 6f suits much better
runners.name: Secret Road
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner for Tristan Davidson in 2024; well below best for Lisa Williamson this autumn (four runs) and struggled to get competitive on recent stable debut at Wolverhampton (5f) but the return to this C&D is a big plus and it won't be a surprise if he comes good for James Owen soon.

runners.comment: In poor form last year, bar his 100-1 third here (5f) in October; others preferred
runners.name: Tilsworth Turf
runners.spotlight: Dual turf winner in 2024 but in poor form last year, bar his 100-1 third here (5f) in October; returns from a short break; difficult to enthuse over.

runners.comment: Placed at 50-1 over 7f here in September but soundly beaten over 6f (on turf) next time
runners.name: Six Of Diamonds
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden; belied 50-1 odds when third over 7f here in September but soundly beaten when dropped back to 6f on turf in October; back from 80-day break today; not the percentage call.

runners.comment: Well down the field when 125-1 for handicap debut here (5f) in October
runners.name: Lilac Wood
runners.spotlight: Well down the field when 125-1 for handicap debut here (5f) in October; moves back up in trip today; could be considered only if much stronger in the betting this time.

14:30.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap (Rider Restricted Race) (Div II)

runners.comment: Rarely seen over a trip this short on the AW, but down to a 0-55 for the first time
runners.name: Court Of Session
runners.spotlight: All four wins over 1m on Polytrack and losing run now up to 22; rarely seen over a trip this short on the AW, but he was twice placed over sprint trips on turf last summer; respected down to a 0-55 for the first time on his 43rd outing.

runners.comment: 1-17 but a fair fourth at Lingfield last time; each-way claims back in trip
runners.name: Horus
runners.spotlight: Patchy form since his sole win at Lingfield (6f, Polytrack) at the end of 2024, but not disgraced when fourth of 12 dropped to this level in this headgear combination there (7f) 13 days ago; each-way claims back in trip.

runners.comment: 1lb below last winning mark and no problem with return to 6f on this track; respected

runners.spotlight: Winner of nine races, the latest a narrow success in a bunch finish at Newcastle (5f, Tapeta) in September; now 1lb lower and no problem with the return to 6f on a track like this; respected.

runners.comment: 0-7 and lightly raced; well held at this level last month; needs more
runners.name: The Cutest
runners.spotlight: Has raced only seven times (debut in October 2023) and well held dropped to this level at Wolverhampton (5f, Tapeta) last month; needs more.

runners.comment: Held in his three starts since Wolverhampton win; drop in trip not the obvious answer
runners.name: Von Krolock
runners.spotlight: 0-31 on turf but 2-9 on the AW, his latest win a narrow success at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta; first-time visor) in November; well held in his three starts since, though, and dropping back in trip doesn't look the obvious answer.

runners.comment: Losing run up to 28 but he could be given a chance on last month's narrow Newcastle defeat
runners.name: Call Glory
runners.spotlight: A bit of a mixed bag lately and losing run now up to 28, but he could be given a chance on his narrow defeat at Newcastle on penultimate outing; shortlisted.

runners.comment: Losing run up to 18, but twice placed over this trip in September; frame material
runners.name: Eldeyaar
runners.spotlight: Losing run up to 18, but placed over this trip at Wolverhampton (Tapeta) and Ripon (good) in September, the latest off 2lb higher; frame material if producing his best.

runners.comment: Not completely disgraced in three starts for this yard but now 0-15 and needs a bit more
runners.name: Rock Master
runners.spotlight: Placed five times off higher marks over 6f/7f on Polytack/turf for Sean Woods last year; not completely disgraced in three starts for this yard, but now 0-15 and needs a bit more.

runners.comment: Losing run up to 25; could figure if they go a good pace and he doesn't blow the start
runners.name: Rory
runners.spotlight: Come-from-behind performer whose losing run is up to 25; could figure if they go a good pace and he doesn't lose too much ground at the start; blinkers make a return.

15:00.race_name: Midnite Are Upping The Betting Game Handicap (Rider Restricted Race)

runners.comment: Beat Hiya Maite with a bit in hand over C&D a week ago; respected in hat-trick bid
runners.name: Ziggys Triton
runners.spotlight: Record over C&D reads 2311, shrugging off a 10lb rise when beating Hiya Mate by just over a length a week ago; up another 5lb under his penalty, but he appeared to win that race with a bit in hand so is seriously respected in his hat-trick bid.

runners.comment: Runner-up to Ziggy's Triton over C&D a week ago; 5lb better off but more is needed
runners.name: Hiya Maite
runners.spotlight: Record over C&D reads 331252163722, finding Ziggy's Triton just over a length too good a week ago; 5lb pull gives him hope and he should again run his race, but more will be needed if he is to reverse the placings.

runners.comment: Won twice over 5f on turf last year but has been off 103 days; no headgear today
runners.name: Mon Na Slieve
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 5f on turf last year and ran well returned to the AW when third of nine at Wolverhampton (5f, Tapeta) in September, but has been off 103 days since; headgear last seven starts but not today.

runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival on stable debut at Newcastle last month; best watched
runners.name: Dorney Lake
runners.owner: Mrs C M Clarke Foulrice Park Racing Ltd
runners.spotlight: Looked promising in his younger days and won last April on his first two starts (6f, turf) after joining Michael Bell, but didn't build on it and failed to beat a rival on stable debut at Newcastle (6f, Tapeta) last month; best watched.

runners.comment: 3-7 on the AW last year; has run well over C&D; not a great surprise should he play a part
runners.name: Counsel
runners.spotlight: 3-7 on the AW last year, his latest win coming at Lingfield (6f, Polytrack) last month; has run well over C&D and it would not be a great surprise should he play a part in the returning tongue-tie.

runners.comment: Losing run stands at 49; not the percentage call
runners.name: Existent
runners.spotlight: Beaten a short head at Chelmsford (6f, Polytrack) in November and has gone close on several other occasions since his last win, but that has become a familiar story with him; losing run stands at 49 and he isn't the percentage call.

runners.comment: 6lb lower than when winning over C&D last May; needs a bit more than when 6th on Thursday
runners.name: Lions House
runners.spotlight: Still 6lb lower than when winning over C&D last May, as he was when beaten only 2l into sixth of 12 at Newcastle (5f, Tapeta) on Thursday; still needs a bit better than that, though.

runners.comment: Finished behind two of these over C&D a week ago; needs to bounce back
runners.name: Jm Jhingree
runners.spotlight: Made all on AW debut at Newcastle (5f, Tapeta) last month but hasn't been able to lead in either start since, as when behind two of these over C&D a week ago; needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: Bolted up in a Chelmsford maiden for the Gosdens as a 3yo but has regressed
runners.name: D Flawless
runners.spotlight: Bolted up in a Chelmsford maiden (1m, Polytrack) for the Gosdens as a 3yo but has regressed; looked to do too much too soon when seventh of ten at Newcastle (5f, Tapeta) last month on her return from 210 days off; best watched for now.

15:35.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap (Rider Restricted Race)

runners.comment: Six wins on the AW, including at Lingfield last month; a player if holding her position
runners.name: Gogo Yubari
runners.spotlight: Six of her seven wins have come on the AW, the latest in returning cheekpieces at Lingfield (5f, Polytrack) last month; 3lb rise manageable and she's a player provided she doesn't find herself too far out of her ground.

runners.comment: 6lb below last winning mark but he produced a modest effort at Newcastle on Thursday.
runners.name: Beneficiary
runners.spotlight: Record over C&D reads 123229 and he has dropped 6lb below his last winning mark, but he produced a modest effort at Newcastle (6f, Tapeta) on Thursday; stable also runs Stroxx.

runners.comment: Record over C&D last year reads 1213; dangerous if again able to dominate
runners.name: Arlington
runners.spotlight: Established trailblazer whose record over C&D last year reads 1213, making all for both wins (ridden by 7lb claimer for latest); taken on early when last of 11 at Newcastle (5f, Tapeta) last month but no surprise if he bounces back, especially if able to dominate.

runners.comment: Has run well a couple of times lately, but is just 1-31; often blows the start
runners.name: Its Showtime
runners.spotlight: Has run well a couple of times lately, as when chasing home Arlington over C&D in October and when beaten a neck by Gogo Yubari at Lingfield (5f, Tapeta) last month; just 1-31, though, and her tardy starts remain a concern.

runners.comment: Made all at Newcastle last time; up 6lb but has been rated much higher in the past
runners.name: Okami
runners.spotlight: Ended a 14-race losing run when making all at Newcastle (5f, Tapeta) 16 days ago on his second start for the yard; 6lb higher and may not be able allowed to dominate in the same way, but he has been rated much higher in the past and may have turned a corner.

runners.comment: Has failed to beat a rival in two starts at Newcastle since returning last month
runners.name: Stroxx
runners.spotlight: Far from prolific (3-69) and has failed to beat a rival in two starts at Newcastle (5f, Tapeta) since returning last month from 210 days off; best watched.

runners.comment: Out of the frame in three AW starts last month despite being prominent in the betting
runners.name: Stash The Cash
runners.owner: D Morgan And K J Parris
runners.spotlight: Three wins over 5f on a soft surface for Tim Easterby as a 3yo; out of the frame in all four starts on the AW, including three for this yard last month, despite being prominent in the betting; interesting to see if his backers return with a visor given a go this time.

runners.comment: Sole win came off 1lb lower over C&D in October; worth a second look returned here
runners.name: Juno Star
runners.owner: The Ten Fools & A Horse Partnership
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced since gaining her sole win from 1lb lower over C&D in October, including when third of eight at Wolverhampton (5f, Tapeta) on Friday; worth a second look returned here.

runners.comment: Sole win came off 3lb lower over C&D in October; return here may help
runners.name: Forest Gunner
runners.spotlight: Held in three starts since gaining her sole win from 3lb lower over C&D in October, but the return here may help.

runners.comment: Runner-up in two 0-50 AW classified events last summer, but not seen since and now 0-20
runners.name: Kipp Kelly
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in 0-50 classified events at Wolverhampton (5f, Tapeta) and over C&D last summer, but not seen since and now 0-20; others make more appeal.

runners.comment: Patchy form lately, winning at Newcastle in November but held otherwise; others preferred
runners.name: Bishops Glory
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on his debut over C&D as a 2yo but has raced exclusively over further since; patchy form lately, winning at Newcastle (6f, Tapeta; first-time visor) in November but held otherwise; others preferred.

runners.comment: 0-9 and out of the frame in all six AW starts; best watched for now
runners.name: Crackinthunder
runners.spotlight: Out of the frame in his six AW starts (all over 5f/6f at Newcastle) and hasn't built on a promising handicap debut when third of eight at Musselburgh (5f, good) in August; best watched for now.

16:05.race_name: Midnite, Building The Future Of Betting Handicap (Rider Restricted Race) (Div I)

runners.comment: Minor honours in the autumn; equipment removed; unraced over this far and can race freely
runners.name: Harswell Duke
runners.spotlight: No win since April 2023 and his AW score is 0-11; clocked up some minor honours in the autumn, including at this track, but well beaten on latest start; recent equipment is removed; unraced over this far and can race freely, so there have to be doubts.

runners.comment: 1-25 AW record (1m4f winner here in 2022); usually wears headgear but now first-time visor
runners.name: Night Bear
runners.spotlight: 1-25 AW record (1m4f winner here in 2022); continues to slide in the handicap and there was a bit more encouragement again last time, but it's not hard to look elsewhere; usually wears headgear but this is first-time visor.

runners.comment: 0-21 on Flat and 0-6 over hurdles; two minor honours over 1m4f here last March
runners.name: Alvesta
runners.spotlight: 0-21 on Flat and 0-6 over hurdles; two minor honours over 1m4f here last March but tailed off over hurdles last month and basically opposable.

runners.comment: Sole win last January; two of three starts last month also suggest he can figure
runners.name: Sisterandbrother
runners.spotlight: Sole AW win came off 7lb higher at Wolverhampton (1m4f, Tapeta) last January; two of three starts last month also suggest he can figure.

runners.comment: Two classified wins; can go well fresh, so needs a second look on first run since July
runners.name: Marinakis
runners.spotlight: Both wins were at classified level on AW early last year; tongue tied last two starts but not today; probably stays 1m4f and can go well fresh, so needs a second look on first run since July.

runners.comment: All AW races on Polytrack, with three of the last four suggesting she could be thereabouts
runners.name: Thundering Breeze
runners.spotlight: Three thirds are her best results from 14 races; all AW races on Polytrack, with three of the last four suggesting she could be thereabouts.

runners.comment: Not disgraced in two of three starts for yard; stamina is a significant question beyond 1m
runners.name: Saxon Kingdom
runners.spotlight: Sole win (34 races) was in Ireland last May; not disgraced in two of his three starts for new yard but unraced over this far on Flat and stamina is a significant question beyond 1m.

runners.comment: Plenty of minor honours last April-June (including C&D) and another on Boxing Day
runners.name: Trusty Scout
runners.spotlight: Last won in November 2023; plenty of minor honours last April-June (including C&D) and another on Boxing Day, which puts him back in the mix.

runners.comment: 0-10; second at Lingfield (1m4f, AW) 18 days ago was her best result since handicap debut
runners.name: Queen Sansa
runners.owner: J W Parry And Mrs C Shekells
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden; has edged down the weights and her second of eight at Lingfield (1m4f, Polytrack) 18 days ago was her best result since handicap debut; each-way claims.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Logis Et Al
runners.comment: 1-34; placed twice at 1m4f on Tapeta last winter; latest start gave a bit of renewed hope
runners.name: Duchess
runners.spotlight: Sole win (34 races) was over 1m on turf in May 2024; unraced at this track but placed twice over 1m4f on Newcastle Tapeta last winter and latest start gave a bit of renewed hope.

runners.comment: Struggled at big prices, latest with blinkers on handicap debut (1m, AW; 80-1) in October
runners.name: Karismatique
runners.spotlight: 150,000gns foal; struggled at big prices in three qualifying runs (7.3f/1m) and no better with blinkers added on handicap debut at Kempton (1m, AW; 80-1) in October; at least his sire is more suggestive of this trip.

16:35.race_name: Midnite, Building The Future Of Betting Handicap (Rider Restricted Race) (Div II)

runners.comment: Pulled up twice in July but she's come good (two wins and a second) on last three outings
runners.name: Krissy

runners.comment: 0-12 and unraced since last January, having finished last in her last two outings
runners.name: Another Beautiful
runners.spotlight: 0-12 and unraced since last January, having finished last in her last two outings; one of her better efforts in 2024 was over 1m6f on Wolverhampton Tapeta, but some caution has to be advised.

runners.comment: Latest win last March (1m6f); in reasonable form recently and probably not far away

runners.spotlight: Five of seven wins were on Wolverhampton Tapeta, including latest last March (1m6f); in reasonable form there recently and effective here too; probably not far away.

runners.comment: Won handicap debut (1m5f, Polytrack) and came second of 12 here (1m6f) 16 days ago
runners.name: Late Claim
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who won handicap debut at Lingfield (1m5f, Polytrack) one month ago and came second of 12 here (1m6f) 16 days ago; back down in trip but one to consider seriously.

runners.comment: 0-25 but recent starts have been competitive; 2nd in two of the last three, including C&D
runners.name: Knight Of Magic
runners.spotlight: 0-25 but recent starts have been competitive; runner-up in two of the last three, including over C&D one week ago when leading at halfway and clear for most of the straight; each-way claims again.

runners.comment: Promise over 6f on debut; well held over 1m since; blinkered for first 7f start
runners.name: Made For Life
runners.spotlight: Well supported in the market when finishing a fair fourth over 6f here on debut but managed only a midfield finish when upped to 1m last month; now drops back to 7f and sports first-time tongue-tie/blinkers; tricky to weigh up.

runners.comment: Only moderate in his first two starts and has the outside draw today
runners.name: Viva Firecracker
runners.spotlight: Only moderate in his first two starts and has the outside draw today; one for further down the line.

runners.comment: Slightly disappointing last time but a win in this grade looks within reach; respected.
runners.name: Invictus Dragon
runners.spotlight: Returned with a pleasing effort when fifth in a blanket finish over 6f here in October, slightly disappointing last time but a win in this grade looks within reach; respected.

runners.comment: Competitive in three of four starts this term; a breakthrough victory looks close
runners.name: Positive Smile
runners.spotlight: Only modest in his debut season but has been competitive in three of four starts this term; a breakthrough victory looks close and he merits serious consideration.

runners.comment: Fourth on seasonal/handicap debut but two lesser efforts have followed
runners.name: Dashing Maurison
runners.spotlight: Stayed on well to finish a fair fourth on his seasonal and handicap debut in September, but has failed to build on that promise in two subsequent runs; needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: Bettered quiet seasonal debut when fourth over 6f last time; back up in trip today
runners.name: Diriya
runners.spotlight: Made a quiet return when down the field over C&D in September but shaped better when fourth last time; now needs to kick on again if he is to play a major role.

runners.breeder: G S A Bloodstock Pty Ltd
runners.comment: Class 5 C&D winner in September but form has dipped lately
runners.name: Fight Time
runners.owner: Daren Wong Wai Chow Lau Kay Jing & Eric Liu Kar Hang
runners.spotlight: Placed in this higher grade since Class 5 C&D win on seasonal debut in September but form has dipped lately; not the percentage call.

runners.comment: Has lost his way since running well on seasonal debut
runners.name: Fortune Warrior
runners.spotlight: 6f dirt winner here last season; returned with a creditable effort in September but has lost his way since and is unraced beyond 6f in Hong Kong after 37 starts.

runners.comment: Won over C&D on HK debut in October and had excuses last time (met traffic)
runners.name: Sagacious Life
runners.spotlight: Won 1m4f Group 1 in Brazil in 2024 and led close home to cause 33-1 surprise over C&D on Hong Kong debut in October; denied clear run when only sixth here in November and remains very much of interest.

runners.comment: In the frame over 1m on all five appearances this season; respected
runners.name: Soleil Fighter
runners.spotlight: In the frame over 1m on all five appearances this season (twice here); holds no secrets from the handicapper but has the inside draw today and ought to be right in the thick of things again.

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khans Studs S C
runners.comment: Began season with a win but subsequent form has been underwhelming
runners.name: Lo Rider
runners.spotlight: Began season with 1m win at Happy Valley but his subsequent form has been underwhelming and he's seemingly still on a tough mark.

runners.comment: Has looked out of sorts this season and needs to turn a corner
runners.name: Voyage Samurai
runners.spotlight: Now only 1lb higher than when making all over C&D in April but has looked out of sorts this season and needs to turn a corner.

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khans Studs S C
runners.comment: Not firing on all cylinders this season and seems best suited by 7f
runners.name: Young Champion
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on some of last season's 7f form but has not been firing on all cylinders this term and is yet to fully convince over 1m.

runners.comment: Dual Group 1 winner in Brazil but makes Hong Kong debut after long absence
runners.name: Winfield
runners.spotlight: 4-8 when based in Brazil, signing off with two Group 1 wins (1m/1m2f) in September/October 2024; looks an interesting recruit to the Hong Kong scene but this local debut comes after a long absence.

runners.comment: Began season in good form over 7f but has a point to prove after some lesser efforts
runners.name: Chiu Chow Spirit
runners.owner: Charlie Lam Leung Seng & Michael Lam Yau Keng
runners.spotlight: Began this season with two good runs over 7f and might still have untapped potential over 1m but his last two runs were disappointing (fluffed the start last time) and he now has a point to prove.

runners.comment: Progressive over 7f last year (three wins); might have more to offer over 1m
runners.name: Top Dragon
runners.owner: Vincent To Wai Keung K To Kin Ting & R To Yiu Ting
runners.spotlight: Progressive over 7f last year, collecting three wins along the way; moves up in grade for this first attempt at 1m but may still have more to offer if the new trip suits.

runners.comment: Both runs this season were respectable and return to this C&D will suit
runners.name: Karma
runners.owner: Manu N Melwani & Roshan Manohar Melwani
runners.spotlight: Made fairly encouraging seasonal/dirt debut in October and probably wasn't suited by drop back to 7f when midfield on turf last month; returns to optimum trip-and-surface combination on a good mark; worth a second look.

runners.comment: 1m2f Listed winner in Britain last year; makes Hong Kong debut today
runners.name: Windlord
runners.spotlight: 2-9 when trained in Britain, the latter win gained in 1m2f Listed race last July; makes Hong Kong debut after a five-month break and may not be ideally suited by the drop back in trip (latest run was over 1m4f) but still looks interesting.

runners.comment: Smart at up to 1m in Australia; makes Hong Kong debut today
runners.name: Daryl Flash
runners.spotlight: Had 3-17 strike-rate in Australia, including 7f Group 3 win in November 2024; placed in two Group 3s (6.7f/1m) when last seen last June; market support will make him of interest on Hong Kong debut.

runners.comment: Not firing on all cylinders this season and faces tough task under top weight
runners.name: Beauty Waves
runners.spotlight: Started off for Tony Cruz with two course wins (5f/6f) at the end of last season but has not been firing on all cylinders this term; drops in grade after contesting 6f Group 1 last month but still faces a tough assignment under top weight.

runners.comment: Made the frame in very similar race to this over C&D in October; a possible
runners.name: Wunderbar
runners.owner: The Hon & Mrs Andrew Li Kwok Nang
runners.spotlight: Fourth (just behind Magic Control) in similar race to this over C&D on seasonal debut in October and also ran well in 6f Group 2 handicap later that month; soundly beaten in two level-weights Group races since but can get much more competitive on these terms.

runners.comment: Twice well beaten since respectable fifth in C&D Group 3 handicap in October
runners.name: Invincible Sage
runners.spotlight: Kept on for respectable fifth (just behind Magic Control and Wonderbar) in C&D Group 3 handicap on seasonal debut in October, but well beaten twice since (6f/5f) and not the most obvious answer today.

runners.comment: Placed in C&D Group 3 handicap in October and returned to form over 6f last month
runners.name: Magic Control
runners.spotlight: Third in similar race to this over C&D in October and put two lesser efforts behind him when second over 6f here last month; remains on a good mark and will be dangerous if in the right mood again.

runners.comment: Badly out of form this season; makes very limited appeal on this rare 5f start
runners.name: Victor The Winner
runners.spotlight: 6f Group 1 winner in his prime but badly out of form this season (6f-1m) and makes very limited appeal on this rare 5f start.

runners.comment: Won very comfortably over C&D in November; big player in first Group race
runners.name: Colourful King
runners.spotlight: Progressive 4yo who made smooth headway before winning very comfortably over C&D in November and is now 3-9 in Hong Kong; 9lb higher for this first attempt at a Group race but still commands respect.

runners.comment: Went close over 6f on seasonal debut but not in same form since
runners.name: Ladys Choice
runners.owner: HK Association Of Lady Horse Lovers Syndicate
runners.spotlight: Went very close over 6f on seasonal debut in October but has not built on that performance since and still needs to prove he's fully effective over 5f.

runners.breeder: C H Cheng & Littlle Avondale Trust
runners.comment: Gave good account when placed behind Colourful King over C&D on stable debut
runners.name: Baby Crystal
runners.owner: Ip Wai Yuen & Chan Tak Wa
runners.spotlight: Four-time C&D winner who gave good account when third behind Colourful King over C&D on stable debut in November; 3lb out of the weights today but still considered each-way.

runners.comment: In good form when last seen in November but 3lb out of the weights today
runners.name: Chateauneuf
runners.spotlight: Won with a bit left in the tank over 6f at Happy Valley in November and subsequent C&D fifth behind Colourful King was perfectly respectable; nicely drawn against the nearside rail again today but effectively 3lb higher from out of the weights.

runners.comment: Made all in Class 3 C&D handicap last month but this is tougher from 4lb wrong
runners.name: Stellar Express
runners.spotlight: Capitalised upon some help from the handicapper when readily making all in Class 3 C&D handicap last month, but not so well drawn today and effectively 11lb higher from 4lb out of the weights.

runners.comment: Began season in good form but didn't fire last time; 8lb wrong today
runners.name: We Are Hero
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with last-gasp C&D win and made the frame over C&D on first two starts this term, but was a disappointing favourite in recent Class 3 handicap won by Stellar Express and is 8lb out of the weights today.

runners.comment: Stayed on for third over C&D on last month's dirt debut; respected
runners.name: Swift Ascend
runners.spotlight: Two good runs this season, the latter a staying-on third over C&D on last month's dirt debut; could still have more to offer on this surface; respected.

runners.comment: Ran okay on seasonal debut but has struggled since, including on dirt debut
runners.name: Dragon Four Seas
runners.owner: Dr Alan Lee Wai Kin Dr Kelvin Chong Man Yuk Et Al
runners.spotlight: Ran fairly well on seasonal debut at Happy Valley (6f, turf) in September but has struggled since, including over C&D on dirt debut; has too much to prove.

runners.comment: Triple C&D winner last season; back on a good mark and can be dangerous from stall 1
runners.name: Must Go
runners.spotlight: Triple C&D winner last season; slow to find his form this term but ended last year with two respectable C&D runs; now 3lb below his last winning mark and can be dangerous from stall 1.

runners.comment: Drawn wide again today but has taken very well to dirt this season; shortlisted
runners.name: Super Joy N Fun
runners.owner: Johnny Wong Chun Nam Nancy Wong Et Al
runners.spotlight: Came from off the pace to win a shade cosily over C&D on dirt debut in October and his subsequent third behind Victory Sky from stall 12 was also a very good effort; drawn wide again today but still considered in current mood.

runners.comment: Kept on strongly to make winning dirt debut over C&D in November; obvious contender
runners.name: Victory Sky
runners.spotlight: 0-15 on turf in Hong Kong but kept on strongly to make winning dirt debut over C&D in November and Zac Purton sidles in for the ride today; obvious contender.

runners.comment: Triple dirt winner last season (1m-1m1f) but out of form lately and opposable over 6f
runners.name: Ariel
runners.spotlight: Won three times on this surface last season (1m-1m1f) and is back on a good mark now, but recent effort have been very disappointing and this is his first run in a sprint since 2022.

runners.comment: Twice in the frame since narrow C&D win in September but has tough draw today
runners.name: Blazing Wind
runners.spotlight: Just held on to score over C&D on seasonal debut in September and has made the frame in this higher grade on both starts since; evidently in good nick but has tough draw today.

runners.comment: C&D winner this season; didn't fire last time and needs a career-best today
runners.name: Fun N Fun Together
runners.spotlight: Won from the front over C&D on seasonal debut in September and was placed in this higher grade on next outing; didn't fire last time, though, and needs to bounce back with a career-best effort.

runners.breeder: A W Jones & Mrs E W Morris
runners.comment: Ran okay on turf last month but needs extra on this rather belated dirt debut
runners.name: Armour War Eagle
runners.spotlight: 1-21 on turf in Hong Kong; kept on for respectable fifth here last month, but needs to find something extra on this belated dirt debut.

runners.comment: Safely held on final two turf starts in 2025 but returns to dirt on a good mark
runners.name: Giant Leap
runners.spotlight: Safely held on final two turf starts last year and not ideally drawn for his dirt return, but is now 6lb lower than when placed over C&D in October; worth a glance in the betting.

runners.comment: Suited by this C&D but has found it hard to make an impact since upped to Class 3
runners.name: Good Luck Babe
runners.spotlight: Went very close over C&D in September and gained compensation when winning narrowly on turf (7f) a fortnight later, but has found it hard to make an impact since upped to this grade.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten on both Hong Kong starts, the first over C&D
runners.name: Herbal Star
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten over C&D on Hong Kong debut in November and also struggled over 1m on turf here last month.

runners.comment: Disappointed on latest turf start and does not have a good dirt record
runners.name: Master Of All
runners.spotlight: Began this season with three very good 7f turf runs (one win) but disappointed on latest outing a fortnight ago and does not have a good record on dirt.

runners.comment: Out of form over 7f/1m on turf when last seen in early 2025; dirt debut
runners.name: Flaming Rabbit
runners.owner: Antonio Chan Hang Tat & Eva Chan Jiao Ting
runners.spotlight: Out of form over 7f/1m on turf when last seen in early 2025 and looks opposable over 6f on dirt debut.

runners.comment: Not at best last time but this largely consistent 7yo is on a workable mark
runners.name: Power Koepp
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Simon Ng Kar Ming
runners.spotlight: Not at best when only seventh at Happy Valley last month, but this largely consistent 8yo won twice there last season and is back on a workable mark now; no surprise if he features.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten on both starts this season and still on fairly tough mark
runners.name: Lifeline Express
runners.spotlight: Unable to land a telling blow on either appearance this season and still on a fairly tough mark; others have more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Began HK career with two good runs and has much better draw than last time
runners.name: Loyal Bright
runners.spotlight: 3-3 when based in Australia and launched Hong Kong career with two very promising runs, the latter a staying-on third from stall 11 over C&D; competes off same mark and has an inside draw today; good chance.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten when a 98-1 outsider for Hong Kong debut in November (5f)
runners.name: E Ho Ho
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo who was soundly beaten when a 98-1 outsider for Hong Kong debut in November (5f); remains best watched.

runners.comment: Finished well for fourth over C&D on last month's Hong Kong debut
runners.name: Galactic Voyage
runners.spotlight: Won 6f maiden on debut in Australia in early 2025 and, following a layoff, finished well for fourth over C&D on last month's Hong Kong debut; drawn much wider today but still a big player if able to build on that performance.

runners.comment: Bounced back to form and ran well from the front when second here last month
runners.name: Igor Stravinsky
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Cyrus Li Kin Wai
runners.spotlight: Well down the field on first three starts this season, but bounced back to form and ran big race from the front when second over C&D last month; might remain a shade vulnerable off current mark but has each-way claims if in the right mood again.

runners.comment: Won 6f maiden on debut in Australia last April; now makes Hong Kong debut
runners.name: Flying Fortune
runners.spotlight: Justified odds-on favouritism when winning 6f maiden on debut in Australia last April; makes Hong Kong debut after eight-month break; interesting to see how he fares.

runners.comment: Has found things tough in this higher grade since narrow C&D win in October
runners.name: Goldentronicmighty
runners.spotlight: Just held on for narrow Class 4 C&D win on seasonal debut in October, but has found things much tougher in this higher grade since.

runners.comment: Has rather mixed record this season but was placed over 5f last month
runners.name: Lucky Eight
runners.spotlight: Has rather mixed record this season and is not ideally drawn today, but kept on for third over 5f here last month and is now 5lb lower than when filling that position over C&D in October; can't be ruled out.

runners.comment: Struggled to get competitive on first two Hong Kong starts (5f/6f)
runners.name: Starry Show
runners.spotlight: Struggled to get competitive on first two Hong Kong starts (5f/6f) and almost certainly needs a drop in grade.

runners.comment: Made quite promising HK debut in November but latest run was a backward step
runners.name: Taogether
runners.owner: Tao Wah Wai Calvin & Chan Yee Kiu
runners.spotlight: Made quite promising Hong Kong debut when staying-on fifth over C&D in November but last month's run was a backward step; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Holding his own in this grade but outside draw dents appeal today
runners.name: Find My Love
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Dannis Lee Cheuk Yin
runners.spotlight: Went very close at Happy Valley on seasonal debut in October and has held his own in this higher grade on both starts since (denied clear run when seventh last time), but outside draw dents his appeal today.

runners.comment: Placed over 7f and 1m this season but this drop back to 6f is not an obvious move
runners.name: Spirit Of Peace
runners.owner: Fong Chung Man Vincent Fong & Lucia Fong So Ching
runners.spotlight: Placed twice in early part of this season (7f/1m) but suffered a dip in form towards the end of last year and this drop back to 6f is not an obvious move.

runners.comment: Class 4 winner from favourable draw in November; safely held in this grade twice since
runners.name: Charming Babe
runners.spotlight: Exploited favourable draw when winning in Class 4 at Happy Valley in November but safely held in this higher grade there twice since.

runners.comment: Placed all four 7f starts since winning over that trip in April; likely contender
runners.name: Everyones Star
runners.spotlight: Opened Hong Kong account with 7f course win in April and has been placed over that trip on all four starts since, losing out only by a nose to Smart Avenue last month; well worth another crack at 1m and ought to be right in the thick of things again.

runners.comment: Scored over C&D in September and has held his form well in the meantime
runners.name: Pope Cody
runners.spotlight: Still 7lb higher than when winning by a head over C&D in September but has held his form well in the meantime and probably won't be far away.

runners.comment: Went very close in 1m2f Royal Ascot handicap last June; Hong Kong debut
runners.name: Seraph Gabriel
runners.owner: Lily Chan Li Lei & Marc Chan
runners.spotlight: 1-5 when based in Britain; absent since going very close in 1m2f handicap at Royal Ascot last June but looks an interesting recruit to the Hong Kong scene.

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khans Studs S C
runners.comment: Ended last season with a C&D win but soundly beaten on both starts this term
runners.name: Morgan Success
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with a ready C&D win but soundly beaten on both starts this term and the handicapper hasn't budged.

runners.comment: Runner-up on seasonal debut but subsequent form has been underwhelming
runners.name: Winning Gold
runners.spotlight: Now 6lb lower than when runner-up over C&D on seasonal debut in September but subsequent form has been underwhelming; needs to up his game.

runners.comment: 3-3 in Australia and made satisfactory Hong Kong debut over C&D
runners.name: Legend Winner
runners.spotlight: 3-3 in Australia and made satisfactory Hong Kong debut when midfield over C&D in November; could have a say if that run brought him on.

runners.comment: A down-the-field outsider on all four Hong Kong starts
runners.name: Panacea
runners.owner: Lyon Cheng Lai Fung Lai Kim Wai Et Al
runners.spotlight: Useful handicapper when based in Britain but a down-the-field outsider on all four Hong Kong starts.

runners.comment: Opened HK account with narrow 7f win last month and this return to 1m will suit
runners.name: Smart Avenue
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Chan Chung Yin & Mr & Mrs Clevin Got Chong Key
runners.spotlight: Opened Hong Kong account at fourth attempt, staying on well to pip Everyone's Star by a nose over 7f here last month; 5lb higher today but likely to be suited by this return to 1m (won over this trip in Australia); high on the list.

runners.comment: Ran big race in defeat on recent stable debut and remains well handicapped
runners.name: Lovero
runners.spotlight: Began this season with two disappointing runs for Tony Cruz but ran big race in defeat over C&D for new stable last month and remains well handicapped on older form; must be considered.

runners.breeder: B J & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.comment: Back up in grade after comfortable 7f win but further progress is possible
runners.name: Wukong Jewellery
runners.spotlight: Came good in Hong Kong at seventh attempt, keeping on strongly for comfortable 7f Class 4 win last month; back up in grade today but the return to 1m won't be a problem and he might use that success as a springboard.

runners.comment: Finding it tough to make a significant impact in this grade this season
runners.name: Harmony Galaxy
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 1m1f in Class 4 at Happy Valley in April but has found it tough to make a significant impact in this higher grade this season; others look stronger.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten on both Hong Kong starts; probably needs a drop in grade
runners.name: Vermilion Tempest
runners.spotlight: Won AW maiden on debut in New Zealand last year but was soundly beaten on first two Hong Kong starts (6f/1m) and probably needs a drop in grade.

runners.comment: 7f winner in November and ran well in this higher grade last month; a possible
runners.name: Bucephalas
runners.spotlight: Kept on strongly to score over 7f on seasonal debut in November and was unlucky not to finish closer than fifth when upped to this higher grade last month; could plausibly still have untapped potential over 1m; considered each-way.

runners.comment: Unplaced all four Hong Kong starts and now eligible for a drop in grade
runners.name: Nova Knight
runners.spotlight: Displayed improvement when sixth at Happy Valley (1m) in November, his third Hong Kong start, but was well beaten there last month and is now eligible for a drop in grade.

runners.comment: Ran well on first two starts for new stable this season (6f/7f) and 1m also suits
runners.name: Silo
runners.spotlight: Placed over 6f here on seasonal/stable debut in November and encountered traffic when close seventh over 7f here last month; also suited by 1m and will enter calculations if he gets a run today.

runners.comment: Signed off in New Zealand with 1m Listed win last May; Hong Kong debut today
runners.name: Do You Just
runners.spotlight: 1-5 in New Zealand, signing off with a 1m Listed win last May; makes Hong Kong debut today; market may guide.
